org.gearvrf

Class GVRTextureCapturer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRTextureCapturer

  • public class GVRTextureCapturer
extends GVRHybridObject
    Captures rendered contents from a shader into a GVRRenderTexture while normal rendering is in progress. A GVRTextureCapturer object can be set into a GVRRenderData, which is passed to the corresponding shader that renders a scene object. The shader's native class can check if capturing is requested, and perform a capture while rendering to screen. Automatic capturing can be set up with a specified FPS value, and after rendering the callback function is called with the captured Bitmap.

      An interface to receive captured Bitmaps.

      • update

        public void update(int width,
                   int height,
                   int sampleCount)
        Updates the backing render texture. This method should not be called when capturing is in progress.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the backing texture in pixels.
        height - The height of the backing texture in pixels.
        sampleCount - The MSAA sample count.

      • setCapture

        public void setCapture(boolean capture,
                       float fps)
        Starts or stops capturing.
        Parameters:
        capture - If true, capturing is started. If false, it is stopped.
        fps - Capturing FPS (frames per second).
